{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3735027,"name":"Nate G","username":"ThatCadGuy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatcadguy/{size}/245471_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T17:54:19.707Z","cooked":"

Recently my teams CNC router kicked the bucket. It was a pretty old machine and the company that made it has gone out of business. So we thought it was time for an upgrade. Were looking for a router that can cut 4x2 sheets of Polycarb and Aluminum. Currently our front runners are the Elite Journeyman from OneFinity and the X-Carve Pro from Inventables. Does anyone have any strong opinions either way? Any other suggestions for what to look at? Anything helps at this point, thanks.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T17:54:19.707Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":398,"readers_count":397,"score":249.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"Nate G","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.onefinitycnc.com/product-page/elite-series-journeyman-48-x32-cut-area?srsltid=AfmBOoooKy78ZPx8W4r4avV3JFlRg4qWUYsPxTw7W4qTTjN1BTPoSMLj","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":67},{"url":"https://www.inventables.com/products/x-carve-pro-4x2-cnc-machine","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"X-CARVE PRO 4X2 CNC SYSTEM | Professional CNC Machine – Inventables, Inc.","clicks":27}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66008,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The host of YOUR Weekly Dose of Mayhem"},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/1","custom_user_title":"The host of YOUR Weekly Dose of Mayhem","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3735031,"name":"rstrawsi","username":"rstrawsi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rstrawsi/{size}/68575_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T18:00:27.760Z","cooked":"

I would highly recommend the OneFinity! You will not be disappointed.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T18:00:27.760Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":395,"readers_count":394,"score":129.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"rstrawsi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20554,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735062,"name":"jedgar6","username":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T19:02:53.445Z","cooked":"

We own a onefinity and we really like it. However, you have to source your own spindle and vfd which isn’t actually fully supported. There are ports on the MASO controller and everything for your own spindle but there is no room in the cable chain for the power cable for the spindle (or the cooling tubes if you get a water cooled spindle). Also you have to buy or source your own table for the cnc including the bed of the cnc.

Another popular option is the shapeoko 5 which has a 2.2kw spindle option.
Shapeoko 5 Pro CNC Router - Carbide 3D?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T19:02:53.445Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":351,"readers_count":350,"score":130.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"jedgar6","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://shop.carbide3d.com/collections/cnc-routers/products/shapeoko5","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Shapeoko 5 Pro CNC Router - Carbide 3D","clicks":17}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33848,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9410"},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/3","custom_user_title":"9410","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735068,"name":"tjwolter - Mentor, supply clerk and chief janitor Team 5826","username":"tjwolter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tjwolter/{size}/131306_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T19:07:49.471Z","cooked":"

You should probably say exactly what you are planning on cutting (1/8th, 1/4?), and what your estimated budget will be. We revived an old XCarve a few years back and never got it working well. We looked at the usual suspects then went with a Shopsaber 23. Fabulous machine. Small CNC Machine | ShopSabre 23 Router | ShopSabre CNC

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T19:08:59.600Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":325,"readers_count":324,"score":75.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"tjwolter - Mentor, supply clerk and chief janitor Team 5826","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.shopsabre.com/cnc-routers/shopsabre-23/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Small CNC Machine | ShopSabre 23 Router | ShopSabre CNC","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28254,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735082,"name":"Woolly","username":"Woolly","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/woolly/{size}/6075_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T19:26:23.436Z","cooked":"

We got a Shapeoko 5 Pro this summer and it’s been working well so far, We found a lightly used 4’ X 2’ model on Facebook Marketplace with a cart, dust collection system, endmills and other goodies included for basically the cost of the router on it’s own new. The shapeokos seem to be common enough you can readily find used ones. We also bought the 1200W VFD but haven’t installed it yet.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T19:26:23.436Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":290,"readers_count":289,"score":63.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"Woolly","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33848,"username":"jedgar6","name":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18296,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735110,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T19:41:00.663Z","cooked":"
ThatCadGuy:

Currently our front runners are the Elite Journeyman from OneFinity and the X-Carve Pro from Inventables.

Speaking from experience, I would strongly recommend NOT planning to cut aluminum on either of these machines. Even our Omio X8 had trouble with Aluminum, and that had a more powerful spindle and more ridged build. Either of these would probably handle wood or polycarbonate fine, but you’re likely going to have a lot of broken bits and failed parts trying aluminum. While the Omio is a bit small, it did what we needed it to, and could be used for aluminum to a limited degree once you got the settings dialed in.

tjwolter:

We looked at the usual suspects then went with a Shopsaber 23. Fabulous machine. Small CNC Machine | ShopSabre 23 Router | ShopSabre CNC

Speaking as a team that just received our ShopSabre RC4 last week, we considered the SS23 as well before deciding we wanted more workspace and a toolchanger. ShopSabre machines are very well-build, ridged, and you can get them with powerful VDF spindles. I’m still on the fence about their control software (coming from Mach3 / PathPilot, it’s a bit limited by comparison), but maybe it’ll grow on me (or I’ll just figure out how to work around it).

Beyond that, while we were looking at the SS23, we also looked at Tormach’s 24R CNC Router, but while it had a better feature set and would have used software we were already familiar with, the higher cost was hard to justify (and we ended up getting the bigger machine anyways).

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T19:41:39.392Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":264,"readers_count":263,"score":122.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.shopsabre.com/cnc-routers/rc-series/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Budget CNC Machine | RC Series CNC Router | ShopSabre CNC","clicks":11},{"url":"https://tormach.com/machines/routers/24r-cnc-router.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"24R - CNC Router","clicks":6},{"url":"https://www.omiocnc.com/products/x8-2200l-usb/x8-2200l-usb-cnc-desktop-engraver.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"X8-2200L Woodworking / Metalworking CNC Router --OMIOCNC -omiocnc.com","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735129,"name":"Zachary","username":"Zatack7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zatack7/{size}/175437_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T19:54:31.850Z","cooked":"

I’ll vouch for OMIO. Very well built, powerful spindle, ball screw, and proper linear rails.

cbale2000:

Even our Omio X8 had trouble with Aluminum, and that had a more powerful spindle and more ridged build.

If you’re having trouble cutting aluminum on an OMIO, it’s either because the machine is defective or your tooling/feeds & speeds are off. An OMIO X8 with a good single flute carbide endmill and proper F&S should be able to rip through aluminum like butter.
Here are two videos from my time running one on my old team. (These videos are also without using particularly aggressive F&Ss.)

Google Drive

OMIO Vids for CD (do NOT delete) - Google Drive

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T19:54:31.850Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":226,"readers_count":225,"score":245.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"Zachary","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1v7PooGftV033OZpH4Cjkmaqq9-siOJgl?usp=sharing","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"OMIO Vids for CD (do NOT delete) - Google Drive","clicks":25}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":13}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53819,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"ban the rev 40a breaker"},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/7","custom_user_title":"ban the rev 40a breaker","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":13,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735134,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T20:01:46.624Z","cooked":"

I’ve seen videos like this but I’ve never been able to replicate it, even when copying feeds and speeds people have suggested verbatim. We’ve always gotten either too much heat buildup over time taking small fast passes, or it’ll just stall the motor from going too slow/deep, and that’s with 1/4" single-flute endmills. We tried some parts using some nice two-flute aluminum endmills which worked for a while, but even those had problems gumming up after a while and forced us to spray on coolant (which isn’t ideal on a MDF wasteboard).

So like, don’t get me wrong, you can do it, but it took far more constant manual intervention than we really wanted to deal with most of the time. Our other machines (and even the Omio cutting poly) you can basically just start and walk away from for hours (not that you should, but you can).

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T20:03:36.193Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":219,"readers_count":218,"score":68.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53819,"username":"Zatack7","name":"Zachary","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zatack7/{size}/175437_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735139,"name":"Zachary","username":"Zatack7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zatack7/{size}/175437_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T20:05:27.388Z","cooked":"

Are you guys using carbide or HSS endmills? Because you shouldn’t be having the problems described. And a small amount of coolant is fine on MDF; you don’t need that much to begin with. What I have going on in that 4mm contour video is too much.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T20:05:27.388Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":76.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"Zachary","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53819,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"ban the rev 40a breaker"},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/9","custom_user_title":"ban the rev 40a breaker","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735145,"name":"jedgar6","username":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T20:20:47.475Z","cooked":"

We cut all our aluminum on our onefinity (2.2kw spindle) and it chews through metal. I’ve also used an omio and it worked very well too.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T20:20:47.475Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":205,"readers_count":204,"score":61.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"jedgar6","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33848,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9410"},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/10","custom_user_title":"9410","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735149,"name":"Nate G","username":"ThatCadGuy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatcadguy/{size}/245471_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T20:22:42.521Z","cooked":"

1/8, 3/16, and 1/4 primarily. Our budget for this is around 5000, and the faster we can get one the better as we use if for our FTC teams.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T20:22:42.521Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":202,"readers_count":201,"score":40.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"Nate G","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28254,"username":"tjwolter","name":"tjwolter - Mentor, supply clerk and chief janitor Team 5826","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tjwolter/{size}/131306_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66008,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The host of YOUR Weekly Dose of Mayhem"},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/11","custom_user_title":"The host of YOUR Weekly Dose of Mayhem","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735152,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T20:24:49.504Z","cooked":"
Zatack7:

Are you guys using carbide or HSS endmills?

Carbide exclusively.

jedgar6:

We cut all our aluminum on our onefinity (2.2kw spindle) and it chews through metal.

Well sure, a 2.2kw would basically make it equivalent to an Omio. OP didn’t really specify so I assumed they were planning on the stock router attachment.

cbale2000:

Well sure, a 2.2kw would basically make it equivalent to an Omio.

OMIOs have linear rails; Onefinities have linear rods, which perform worse and wear differently. @asid61 You were talking about this in the discord the other day, do you have anything to add?

Well, you’re gonna get a lot of advice on this. Please don’t rush the decision. Its one you want to get right. We were only able to afford the Shopsabre 23 with the help of some grant money. It was worth the wait.

M.","username":"MartinLM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/martinlm/{size}/230265_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T21:54:53.761Z","cooked":"

The Onefinity is very nice, we’ve used it for polycarb and wood and its been great. It’s good for aluminium too but for my team specifically there is still some tuning required for it. We have the Woodworker with the Stiffy.

M.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.onefinitycnc.com/product-page/x-50-stiffy-for-woodworker-x-50-pro-elite-machines","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":2},{"url":"https://www.onefinitycnc.com/product-page/original-series-woodworker-32-x32-cut-area","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56645,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3161 Design Lead"},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/16","custom_user_title":"3161 Design Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735260,"name":"Rich Jr","username":"rich.varone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rich.varone/{size}/167373_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T21:55:28.162Z","cooked":"
cbale2000:

Beyond that, while we were looking at the SS23, we also looked at Tormach’s 24R CNC Router, but while it had a better feature set and would have used software we were already familiar with, the higher cost was hard to justify (and we ended up getting the bigger machine anyways).

We have a 24R and highly recommend it with the ATC and a Saunders Machine Works Fixture Plate/Mod Vise System, it’s biggest downside is the cost, but with that you do get pretty good support from Tormach. Other benefits are that you can pull a vacuum through the fixture plate if needed. We also do an aluminum waste board on top of the fixture plate with a MQL system we modded on.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T21:58:27.168Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":63.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506128,"topic_slug":"in-need-of-a-new-router","display_username":"Rich Jr","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6998,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271"},"post_url":"/t/in-need-of-a-new-router/506128/17","custom_user_title":"FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735273,"name":"Nick Foote","username":"Footie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/footie/{size}/218325_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T22:06:00.703Z","cooked":"

Our two OMIOs cut what we need it to cut (polycarb, wood, aluminum, we’ve cut up to 0.3in thick) and the tube jig is great, but in the year we’ve had them, we’ve had several electrical components go bad (connectors). We also thought our VHD was dead, but we opened it up and located and soldered a connection that should have been soldered in the first place, but was just press fit on (and had come loose).

Support for replacement parts through Andy Mark has been subpar, and we ended up just making our own replacement cables for the stepper motors because we can’t get actual replacements.

They’re also just a little too small to cut a belly pan, or long elevator tubes in a single operation.

If you have the space for a larger bed, I’d consider those options.
